image.altText: Matt Wright walks while surrounded by people holding cameras and microphones outside the Darwin Local Court.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright has been committed to stand trial in the NT Supreme Court on a charge relating to a helicopter crash that killed his friend and television co-star Chris "Willow" Wilson.

title.children: Celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright to stand trial over fatal chopper crash

image.altText: A gas platform in the Timor Sea.

props.synopsis: A group of Tiwi Islands elders have faced off against Santos in the Federal Court, over the gas giant's plans to build a pipeline for its $5.6 billion Barossa project.

title.children: Santos lawyers accuse traditional owners of altering dreaming stories to block gas pipeline

image.altText: Silhouettes of children read and throw a ball on a peach-coloured background. Houses and upward trending arrows are also seen

props.synopsis: The final report from the NDIS review has made 26 recommendations and detailed close to 140 "actions" it says are needed to transform the scheme over the next five years. Here are the biggest takeaways.

title.children: 'The moment has come': The biggest changes flagged in the NDIS review

image.altText: A young woman with a cream button-down shirt smiles at the camera. She is outside.

props.synopsis: In the remote community of Maningrida in the heart of Arnhem Land, graduating high school is an accomplishment worth celebrating. Hundreds of people have packed into the school's basketball court to celebrate the graduation of six of their own.

title.children: As thousands of students finish their schooling, this remote NT community is doing graduation differently

image.altText: Anthony albanese wears a grey suit and leans on a table in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: For the Albanese government, the 12 days of its second Christmas in office were definitely not meant to look like this, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.

title.children: No one was expecting the parliamentary year to end like this

image.altText: Cyclone weather satellite photo

props.synopsis: Cyclone Jasper's future track is slowly becoming clearer and the latest modelling data indicates the northern tropical coast is the most likely target.

title.children: Heatwave could have final say on Cyclone Jasper's track with northern tropical coast most likely target

image.altText: Josh Taylor holds up a fish

props.synopsis: Josh Taylor, 23, died in hospital five days after he was buried under more than a metre of sand on Bribie Island.

title.children: Man buried in sand on Bribie Island dies in hospital

image.altText: People wearing white aprons sit around a table and eat food. They have large platters in front of them and all look happy.

props.synopsis: People on the National Disability Insurance Scheme and providers are worried the federal government's push to curb its ballooning costs will mean they lose vital services.

title.children: 'Scary prospect': People on the NDIS and providers fear big review cuts

image.altText: A driver hovers above a golf ball which sits on a tee

props.synopsis: One of the most significant technological changes to the game of golf has been confirmed, and it is set to impact both touring professionals and weekend hackers alike. Here's everything you need to know about the golf ball roll-back.

title.children: Tiger Woods is on board, but other golf stars are calling new ball rules 'monstrous' for amateurs

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann outside court, surrounded by media.

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds's former staffer Nikita Irvine says "women's intuition" told her not to spend time with Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Former colleague says Bruce Lehrmann gave her 'bad vibes' as defamation trial continues

image.altText: Alan Jones speaks to media

props.synopsis: Lawyers acting on behalf of former radio broadcaster Alan Jones say they are taking the "first step" in commencing defamation proceedings over newspaper allegations he indecently assaulted four young men.

title.children: Alan Jones threatens defamation action over allegations he indecently assaulted four young men

image.altText: A close up of a middle-aged man in a high-viz polo shirt and padded vest, speaking outside and gesturing with one hand

props.synopsis: The Australian mining magnate and climate campaigner lashes out at oil and gas supremos he says are "selfish beyond belief".

title.children: Andrew Forrest calls for fossil fuel bosses' 'heads on spikes' in extraordinary outburst

image.altText: Australian PM Anthony Albanese and James Marape, PNG PM shake hands like lifelong friends

props.synopsis: Prime ministers Anthony Albanese and James Marape meet in Canberra to deepen security ties with a pact that has a status like a treaty, while Beijing continues its push to expand policing ties with Pacific Island countries and regional defence chiefs discuss a joint military response group.

title.children: Australia signs sweeping security pact with PNG as China continues push for policing influence in Pacific

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie standing and speaking into a microphone at a lecturn. He holds up one clenched hand

props.synopsis: Australia's head lawmaker has apologised to a Sky journalist after a heated exchange at a press conference the prime minister says didn't meet parliamentary standards.

title.children: Attorney-general apologises to journalist after heated interaction, PM says standards not met

image.altText: Four soldiers holding guns.

props.synopsis: The United Nations chief urged the UN Security Council to use its clout to avert "a humanitarian catastrophe" in Gaza.

title.children: Israel military says they are encircling Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar's house – as it happened

image.altText: Police outside a high school

props.synopsis: Two high school students are injured and taken to hospital in Perth after what the school's principal is calling a "serious incident".

title.children: Two Perth high school students injured in 'serious incident' on school grounds

image.altText: Man and woman sit on a seat in a garden.

props.synopsis: The Australian actor hopes Master Gardener, the new film by veteran director and screenwriter Paul Schrader, will spark debate.

title.children: Joel Edgerton's new Hollywood film has divided critics — which he says is what its director wanted

image.altText: An NDIS logo on a peach-coloured background. A hand is writing the words "reasonable and neccessary" next to a stack of coins

props.synopsis: Creating more services outside the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) and hinging access on impairment instead of medical diagnosis are among the key recommendations from a long-awaited review.

title.children: NDIS review recommends changes to access through need, not diagnosis

image.altText: Brett Loughlin speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: South Australians are urged to prepare for what is forecast to be one of the most significant fire weather days in years, along with the potential for power outages.

title.children: 'Do not rely on firefighters': South Australians urged to prepare ahead of predicted catastrophic fire conditions

image.altText: Radar map of Cyclone Jasper

props.synopsis: Cyclone Jasper is currently south of the Solomons and was upgraded to a category three late yesterday afternoon.

title.children: Tropical Cyclone Jasper could intensify to category four overnight, forecast to hit north of Mackay

image.altText: Two men taking two large boxes out of a larger wooden box and placing them on the ground.

props.synopsis: Yawuru traditional owners have welcomed home the remains of an ancestor stolen from their lands and held in the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History in Washington DC.

title.children: US museum returns Indigenous man's stolen remains to WA after 126 years

image.altText: A group of people in a canal next to two gondolas

props.synopsis: The tourists reportedly ignored requests by the gondola operator to sit down and stop taking photos.

title.children: Venice gondola capsizes, sending snap-happy tourists into the canals

image.altText: five colourful vapes standing on a black-coloured counter

props.synopsis: Laws that aim to reduce the appeal of smoking and limit the ability of the tobacco industry to market the product passed federal parliament on Thursday. Follow the daily blog for all the latest news in business, finance and the markets.

title.children: As it happened: ASX closes lower, dollar to drop, laws to stop smoking pass

image.altText: King Charles III smiles while wearing a grey suit with a blue tie with the Greek flag and a matching handkerchief

props.synopsis: A cancelled meeting with the Greek PM and King Charles's choice of tie have reignited debate over the return of the Parthenon marbles, which currently sit in the British Museum, to Greece.

title.children: For years Greece has asked for the UK to return ancient sculptures. Then, King Charles's tie entered the debate

image.altText: Osprey military aircraft taking off from landing helicopter assault vessel.

props.synopsis: The US military takes the extraordinary step of grounding hundreds of aircraft after a preliminary investigation of last week's fatal crash indicated that something wrong with the aircraft — and not a mistake by the crew — led to the accident.

title.children: US military grounds entire fleet of Osprey aircraft following latest deadly crash off Japan

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan in a high vis jacket and hard hat addressing media.

props.synopsis: The Victorian premier dismisses concerns of a "culture of fear" in the Victorian public service as "commentary", the day after an ombudsman's damning report was released.

title.children: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan talks down ombudsman's 'culture of fear' finding

image.altText: A young protester is arrested in black and white

props.synopsis: Baby boomers have been copping criticism from the day they were born, from being too left-wing and delinquent, to being too conservative and greedy, but researchers suggest much of the criticism doesn't stack up.

title.children: From birth to retirement, a 'bonkers' history of baby boomers getting blamed for everything

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing, neck tattoos and long hair looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: The Arizonan extremist linked to the Wieambilla siege was understood to be a figure in the shooters' lives for more than two years before they murdered three people.

title.children: Donald Day has been arrested in connection with the Wieambilla terror attack. Here's what we know

image.altText: Man in black suit stands behind podium

props.synopsis: Sources say Ukraine orchestrated the assassination of the former Ukrainian politician, who defected to Russia. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: Ukrainian security services reportedly assassinate politician who defected to Russia

image.altText: A woman's hands hold an orange furoshiki wrapped gift decorated with eucalyptus leaf stems on a white table.

props.synopsis: From handmade spoons to indoor plants, here are some ideas to make your Christmas gifting more sustainable and affordable.

title.children: From chopping boards to plant cuttings: Try these homemade gift ideas this Christmas

image.altText: An artistic portrait of Maggie Beer, featuring a pheasant, pomegranate, flowers and leaves.

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most remarkable women have joined forces for a new portrait, unveiled at the National Portrait Gallery today.

title.children: Celebrity cook Maggie Beer reveals favourite fruits and vegetables in 'absolutely psychedelic fantasy' portrait

image.altText: David Pocock sits behind Jacqui Lambie while she speaks in the senate

props.synopsis: First responders will have easier access to post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) compensation and contractors will receive the same pay as full-time employees in the same role, after the government agreed to crossbench demands.

title.children: Pocock and Lambie force government to split industrial relations changes. Here's what's happening

image.altText: Simon Birmingham close up.

props.synopsis: The shadow minister for foreign affairs will lead a cross-party delegation to Israel, meeting with Palestinian and Israeli officials.

title.children: Simon Birmingham to lead cross-party delegation to Israel

image.altText: Older woman in a red shirt sitting in a dining room.

props.synopsis: After growing up in an uninsulated house that sometimes reached 50 degrees Celsius during summer, Yvonne Parker decided to create an energy-efficient home for her retirement.

title.children: Yvonne's power bills are less than $80 a month. Here's how she did it

image.altText: An elderly woman swimming laps in a pool from a bird's eye view.

props.synopsis: With four recent gold medals for swimming at the Australian Masters Games, and an ambition to go hang-gliding, nonagenarian Noeline Dahlen-Maclean says "yes" to life.

title.children: Secrets to a long life revealed by 93yo champion swimmer
